author: Johannes Vermeer
null: vermeer composition balance angles figures liberties exceptional place sense white plasterwork triangle walls painting oversized green shutters dynamism reality quiet street coarse bricks
painting: View of Houses in Delft, Known as ‘The Little Street’
description: This painting of a quiet street with a few figures occupies an exceptional place in Vermeer’s oeuvre. Straightangles give the composition balance, while the triangle of the sky introduces a sense of dynamism. The oldwalls, coarse bricks, and white plasterwork are almost palpable. Vermeer nonetheless took some libertieswith reality, such as the oversized green shutters.
